usefulItems: square cake tin (18 cm x 18 cm), baking paper, oven
title: Peanut butter choc chip slice

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a baking tin (18 x 18 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place self-raising flour and plain flour into mixing bowl and mix <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add oats, coconut and sugar and mix <b>3 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place peanut butter, butter and honey into mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/50°C/speed 3<b>.
Add reserved flour mixture and egg and mix <b>10 sec/speed 2<b>.
Add 90 g of the chocolate chips into mixing bowl and combine <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Repeat mixing <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>.
Transfer mixture into prepared baking tin and sprinkle with remaining chocolate chips. Bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C). Set aside to cool, then cut into pieces to serve.
